com.deltaxml.pipe

Class AncestorXMLFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xml.sax.helpers.XMLFilterImpl
      • com.deltaxml.pipe.XMLFilterImpl2
        • com.deltaxml.pipe.AncestorXMLFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.xml.sax.ContentHandler, org.xml.sax.DTDHandler, org.xml.sax.EntityResolver, org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler, org.xml.sax.ext.DeclHandler, org.xml.sax.ext.LexicalHandler, org.xml.sax.XMLFilter, org.xml.sax.XMLReader
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PCDataConcatenatingInfilter, WordBufferingFilter

    public class AncestorXMLFilter
extends XMLFilterImpl2
    Stores a stack of the elements that are ancestor to the current context in the SAXStream.

    Example

    With the following XML: 

     <root>
   <a/>
   <b>
     <c/>
   </b>
 </root>

    When the startElement SAXEvent has been called for the element <c/>, the ancestor stack will look like:

    • c
    • b
    • root

    This allows your code (which extends AncestorXMLFilter) to query the stack to find out if there are ancestors which meet given criteria (for example am I a descendant of <b/>).

    This saves you from having to store lots of status information in your filter (e.g. booleans like inA or inB).

    Use

    To make use of this filter, extend it (rather than extending XMLFilterImpl). Elements are added to the stack in the AncestorXMLFilter.startElement(String, String, String, Attributes) methods and removed from the stack in the AncestorXMLFilter.endElement(String, String, String) methods.

    If you need to push/pop an element before you make your super.startElement call, for example if you're buffering, then you can use AncestorXMLFilter.pushAncestorStack(String, String, String, Attributes) and AncestorXMLFilter.popAncestorStack(String, String, String) to control the stack. These should be used in conjunction with AncestorXMLFilter.outputStartElement(String, String, String, Attributes) and AncestorXMLFilter.outputEndElement(String, String, String) which are the same as startElement and endElement, but don't push/pop the stack.

      • popAncestorStack

        public void popAncestorStack(java.lang.String uri,
                             java.lang.String localName,
                             java.lang.String qName)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Checks that the top element of the stack is the same as the supplied element, if it is then pops the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        uri - The element's NS uri.
        localName - The element's localName
        qName - The element's qName
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is thrown when the element at the top of the stack is not the same as the supplied element's details.
        See Also:
        Stack.pop()

      • hasAncestor

        public boolean hasAncestor(java.lang.String uri,
                           java.lang.String localName,
                           int ancestorLimit)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Looks for ancestors.
        Parameters:
        uri - the namespace uri of the ancestor element to look for
        localName - the localname of the ancestor element to look for
        ancestorLimit - The number of ancestors to consider. If negative unlimited ancestors are considered, otherwise a number representing the number to consider; to only consider parents should be 1, grandparents 2 etc. If zero then will not consider anything and will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        a boolean stating whether or not the ancestor stack contains the element specified within the given distance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the ancestorLimit parameter is zero

      • hasAncestor

        public boolean hasAncestor(java.lang.String uri,
                           java.lang.String localName)
        Looks for matching ancestors along the entire depth of the ancestor stack. Same as calling hasAncestor(uri, localName, -1).
        Parameters:
        uri - the namespace URI of the ancestor element to test for
        localName - the localname of the ancestor to test for
        Returns:
        a boolean stating whether or not the ancestor stack contains the element specified
        See Also:
        AncestorXMLFilter.hasAncestor(String, String, int)

      • hasAncestorWithAttr

        public boolean hasAncestorWithAttr(java.lang.String elementURI,
                                   java.lang.String elementLocalName,
                                   java.lang.String attrURI,
                                   java.lang.String attrLocalName,
                                   int ancestorLimit)
        Returns whether there is an ancestor with the given attribute.
        Parameters:
        elementURI - The namespace URI of the element to match
        elementLocalName - The local name of the element to match
        attrURI - The namespace URI of the attribute to match
        attrLocalName - The local name of the attribute to match
        ancestorLimit - The number of ancestors to consider. If negative unlimited ancestors are considered, otherwise a number representing the number to consider; to only consider parents should be 1, grandparents 2 etc. If zero then will not consider anything and will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        whether there is an ancestor with the given attribute.

      • hasAncestorWithAttrValue

        public boolean hasAncestorWithAttrValue(java.lang.String elementURI,
                                        java.lang.String elementLocalName,
                                        java.lang.String attrURI,
                                        java.lang.String attrLocalName,
                                        java.lang.String attrValue,
                                        boolean ignoreCase,
                                        int ancestorLimit)
        Returns whether there is an ancestor of the given element type that has an attribute that matches the supplied value.
        Parameters:
        elementURI - The namespace URI of the element to match
        elementLocalName - The local name of the element to match
        attrURI - The namespace URI of the attribute to match
        attrLocalName - The local name of the attribute to match
        attrValue - The value allowed for the attribute's value
        ignoreCase - Whether to ignore the case of the attribute's value
        ancestorLimit - The number of ancestors to consider. If negative unlimited ancestors are considered, otherwise a number representing the number to consider; to only consider parents should be 1, grandparents 2 etc. If zero then will not consider anything and will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        whether there is an ancestor of the given element type that has an attribute that matches the supplied value

                                         java.lang.String attrLocalName,
                                         java.lang.String[] allowedValues,
                                         boolean ignoreCase,
                                         int ancestorLimit)
        Returns whether there is an ancestor of the given element type that has an attribute that matches the supplied values.

        elementLocalName - The local name of the element to match
        attrURI - The namespace URI of the attribute to match
        attrLocalName - The local name of the attribute to match
        allowedValues - The values allowed for the attribute's value
        ignoreCase - Whether to ignore the case of the attribute's value
        ancestorLimit - The number of ancestors to consider. If negative unlimited ancestors are considered, otherwise a number representing the number to consider; to only consider parents should be 1, grandparents 2 etc. If zero then will not consider anything and will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        whether there is an ancestor of the given element type that has an attribute that matches the supplied values

      • getClosestAttributeValueFromAncestor

        public java.lang.String getClosestAttributeValueFromAncestor(java.lang.String elementURI,
                                                             java.lang.String elementLocalName,
                                                             java.lang.String attrURI,
                                                             java.lang.String attrLocalName,
                                                             int ancestorLimit)
        Returns the value of the given attribute on the ancestor of the given type that is nearest the top of the ancestor stack which has a value for the given attribute.
        Parameters:
        elementURI - The namespace URI of the element to match
        elementLocalName - The local name of the element to match
        attrURI - The namespace URI of the attribute to match
        attrLocalName - The local name of the attribute to match
        ancestorLimit - The number of ancestors to consider. If negative unlimited ancestors are considered, otherwise a number representing the number to consider; to only consider parents should be 1, grandparents 2 etc. If zero then will not consider anything and will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        the value of the given attribute on a given ancestor, returns null if no ancestor has the attribute.

      • getClosestAttributeValueFromAnyAncestor

        public java.lang.String getClosestAttributeValueFromAnyAncestor(java.lang.String attrURI,
                                                                java.lang.String attrLocalName,
                                                                int ancestorLimit)
        Returns the value of the given attribute on the ancestor nearest the top of the ancestor stack which has a value for the given attribute.
        Parameters:
        attrURI - the namespace URI of the requested attribute
        attrLocalName - the localname of the requested attribute
        ancestorLimit - The number of ancestors to consider. If negative unlimited ancestors are considered, otherwise a number representing the number to consider; to only consider parents should be 1, grandparents 2 etc. If zero then will not consider anything and will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Returns:
        the value of the given attribute on a ancestor, returns null if no ancestor has the attribute.

      • outputStartElement

        public void outputStartElement(java.lang.String uri,
                               java.lang.String localName,
                               java.lang.String qName,
                               org.xml.sax.Attributes atts)
                        throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Similar to startElement. However, unlike startElement, the element is not pushed onto the ancestor stack.
        Parameters:
        uri - the element's namespace URI
        localName - the element's localname
        qName - the element's qualified name
        atts - the element's attributes
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - the supertype may throw a SAXException during processing
        See Also:
        XMLFilterImpl.startElement(String, String, String, Attributes), XMLFilterImpl.startElement(String, String, String, Attributes)

      • outputEndElement

        public void outputEndElement(java.lang.String uri,
                             java.lang.String localName,
                             java.lang.String qName)
                      throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Similar to endElement. However, unlike endElement, the element is not popped from the ancestor stack.

        localName - the element's localname
        qName - the element's qualified name

      • stackDepth

        public int stackDepth()
        Returns the current depth of the ancestor stack. A value of 0 is returned when the stack is currently empty and that you're processing the root node.
        Returns:
        the current depth of the ancestor stack.
